website_summaries.verdict: A solid choice for its overall versatility and durability. On the cheaper side for an All-Clad pan.
pros: Fast and even cooking performance that's ideal for all recipes
Its wide and flat base makes this fry pan a versatile choice for cooks of all levels
cons: Although it's technically dishwasher safe, most consumers recommend hand-washing to preserve the nonstick surface

customer_reviews.title: Everything Sticks
customer_reviews.text: The first time we used the pan it was great. Every use after has been awful. Food sticks, regardless of type of oil/butter we use or how much, and it's really difficult to clean. The second photo I posted is after we cooked eggs and I soaked the pan overnight. The food still didn't come off easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jami

customer_reviews.title: 8 inch fry pan
customer_reviews.text: Heats up quick, washes well, wife is happy. I am required to use 12 more words in this review. Potato.
customer_reviews.author: SLULPLAL

customer_reviews.title: I love All-Clad cookware
customer_reviews.text: I love All-Clad cookware. It is built to last a lifetime. This small pan has an 8" outer diameter and perhaps 5" flat interior surface so it works well for smaller cuts of meat, etc. Just understand if you embark on using cookware such as this, you have to go at it a bit differently than cast iron or non-stick. Just get some Bar Keeper's Friend or some other such stainless cleaner, learn the cooking techniques, and you are set for a lifetime of cooking pleasure. If you are more of a non-stick, convenience sort of person, this is probably not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jones

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a non-stick pan.
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to what I was told, (Like that never happened before) This pan works well, but food sticks to the surface, requiring a scrubbing to clean it, and you have to oil it before and after each use. So if you like washing and scrubbing, this is the perfect pan!
customer_reviews.author: Jim S.

customer_reviews.title: The best advice is to use lower heat than used too ...
customer_reviews.text: This was the first All-Clad purchase and was little hesitant at first. We normally cook with no stick pans and took a little time to master. These cook with even heat. The best advice is to use lower heat than used too and that seems helps with sticking. We have purchased several more All-clad pans since this and will continue to replace our old pans.
customer_reviews.author: Peter75

customer_reviews.title: All-Clad's are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I've grown to love All-Clad...once you learn to use them, they really are some of the best cookware I've used. Cast iron is a little easier on cleanup but the weight of cast iron...bleh! On a side note: I've purchased D3's and D5's...D5's are prettier but much heavier. From now on I'm sticking with the D3's (and lower heat). The extra mass of the D5 didn't seem to make much difference in searing things, however, the D3's do seem to burn easier...but the weight difference...well, if you compare a D5 to a D3 side by side, you'll know what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: oNE Big Pan
customer_reviews.text: i read the reviews before purchasing and yet I bought it anyway we cook for a family of 7 big eaters. the pan is slightly dome shaped in the middle as described in the reviews but it still cooks. The instructions fails to remind people to season the pan so it will not stick fortunately I am a big fan of stainless steel and know this,besure you do this before cooking in it . All in all I got what I expected
customer_reviews.author: Pauline G.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't live up to the brand.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pan for an investment and possibly replace nonstick pans for good. But I couldn't tell the difference between this high end brand and a cheaper one. It is made well but doesn't clean up very well. And there's a lot of upkeep needed to keep it looking nice. I'm not sure I will spend this much money for a pan like this.
customer_reviews.author: S Kim

customer_reviews.title: Was expecting much better quality
customer_reviews.text: Feels good in your hand, but The pan stains very easily compared to other pans I'm working with and that makes it a real pain to clean,very disappointed especially for the price...
customer_reviews.author: galg

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Hard-Anodized!
customer_reviews.text: First I had stainless with an aluminum disk on the bottom. Okay, but it didn't distribute heat very well up the sides. I replaced the disk-bottom cookware with non-stick hard-anodized aluminum. The non-stick surface didn't last well, and I have been very gentle with it. This pan is everything that America's Test Kitchen has reported for All-Clad tri-ply. It distributes the heat evenly up the side instead of just on the bottom, and although it isn't non-stick, clean up is easy. I just heat some water in it for a couple of minutes, and most residue slides right out of the pan.
customer_reviews.author: HorizonMistress42

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Ive always been hesitant to buy a stainless steel pan because past experiences had left me frustrated with the clean up. This pan is easy to clean and a little sprinkle of the all clad cleaner has it sparkling like new after every use. I find myself reaching for this pan frequently. I plan on investing in more all clad pans.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Rheaume

customer_reviews.title: Best pan for the money.
customer_reviews.text: My searing-game has gone way up with this All-Clad pan. Holds a ton of heat, distributed evenly, and sears a chunk of meat like nobody's business. I'm guessing this is a 'loss-leader' for All-Clad, as it was significantly cheaper than any of their other products at my time of purchase. Folks buy this for relatively cheap, they love it, and then they buy more products at a higher profit margin. Well, it works! I certainly intend to purchase more All-Clad pots and pans in the future.
customer_reviews.author: churry

customer_reviews.title: Even with Oil, This Pan Burns/Sticks Everything
customer_reviews.text: Even with a proper coat of oil, this pan does not perform well. Having cooked with numerous different types of pans, this is probably the worst pan I have ever used, especially when you consider it costs over $100. In addition, the handle is extremely uncomfortable to use, particularly when tossing your ingredients solely using the pan. I do not recommend this product. It is not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Broadwater

customer_reviews.title: Nice pans but sometimes they are not flat on the bottom.
customer_reviews.text: If you cook on a glass topped electric stove, beware - all-clad quality control is not very good. I've had multiple pans show up that are not even close to flat on the bottom, so only half the pan touches the stove and you have a pan with a hot half and a cooler half. Totally aggravating and it's something I never saw even once with the cheap pots and pans I used to get from ikea when I lived close enough to an ikea to shop there. I just don't get it.
customer_reviews.author: Bert	Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and Distributes Heat
customer_reviews.text: It joins our other All-Clad pots and pans. They distribute heat evenly and are easy to clean by hand. We avoid putting them in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite pan
customer_reviews.text: This thing is worth the money. After years of cooking on teflon and anodized aluminum, I wasn't quite sure what to expect from a stainless steel pan. But this pan has delivered some of the best dishes I have ever cooked. Meat browns beautifully. I can throw it in the oven to finish cooking. And I don't have to be timid when cooking or washing it, because it is built to last. I borrowed one from a friend before buying mine and his cooks just as well after years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Willmon

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Great size. Be careful with low smoking level oils. Used virgin olive oil to grill steaks. 5/5 min on each side and the oil smoked the whole pan turning it black lol took almost 20 min with baking soda and scrub pad to make the pan new again. Lesson learned. Great pan non the less.
customer_reviews.author: icu2tsx

customer_reviews.title: Great Pan
customer_reviews.text: If you know how to manage your heat when cooking, this is a great pan. I've had mine for a week and I've been making perfect, cigar-shaped 2-egg omelettes with little to no color, every morning. Give it a little soak when it cools off and it cleans up like new. I can see how some folks may have a problem. My advice; keep practicing!
customer_reviews.author: Frank J. Rodino

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in how everything sticks to pan, makes it impossible to get clean Unusual for an all-clad pan.
customer_reviews.author: FRAN T.

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: So happy we switched to stainless. It’s beautiful pan, price was good and it’s easy to maintain. I definitely looked up tips on stainless steel before switching and so far so good- easy to clean and keep pretty with ‘bar keepers friend’ every so often.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice pan!
customer_reviews.text: Much lighter in weight than I anticipated. Mine arrived a tiny bit wobbly from side to side. When I called All-Clad, I was told this is normal due to the pan being manufactured to be slightly concave and that it should flatten out upon heating. Did it? Not really, no. But it is also not causing a problem...yet. When it does, I am pleased to know the company stands behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: It’s All-Clad...
customer_reviews.text: Build like a tank, cooks like a pro & very easy to clean, we throw it into the dishwasher and time to time i use “Barmans friend” to polish and remove any leftover gunk All-clad is the best of the best!
customer_reviews.author: saadya blackman

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful almost 10inches of cooking space I ordered the 12 inch fry pan
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Trueblood

customer_reviews.title: Nice All-Clad Frying pan
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of this pan and I like All-Clad’s cookware. I have other pans. However, things do tend to stick, but I just soak the pan with Dawn and then it is fairly easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: MTA

customer_reviews.title: Great skillet
customer_reviews.text: Some of the best skillets available. Maybe the best. Light but build is great. Oven safe. Very healthy cooking surface. Go this route or Lodge Cast Iron. Get rid of non stick
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Kulawiak

customer_reviews.title: Best skillet on the market, last over 20 years
customer_reviews.text: My chef husband bought one of these over 20 years ago for home use. It's such a treasured item in our home that my 2 kids were arguing over who gets it when we're gone. So I bought one for each of them on their 25th birthdays.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Welborn

customer_reviews.title: Starting to get better. Feel like in 6 months it will be ...
customer_reviews.text: May update my review, but have been using this pan daily for a month - am starting to see some improvement, but it was initially almost impossible not to have anthing/everything stick. Have seasoned, have avoided soap, have pre-heated before oil - I get it, but this thing is sticky. Starting to get better. Feel like in 6 months it will be great. Solid, good balance, good size.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: A Little Lighter Than My 20 Year Old All-Clad Skillet
customer_reviews.text: Although this new ten inch D3 skillet is a little lighter than my old one, I like it anyway, because it heats quickly, and holds that heat well. So, I still recommend the D3 All-Clad cookware.
customer_reviews.author: D. Berry

customer_reviews.title: great pan for the price
customer_reviews.text: well-designed to distribute heat, we like that it doesn't weigh as much as other pans we've used for same purposes. The handle is a bit bigger than we were needing, a little harder to store, but we're pleased overall.
customer_reviews.author: Peregrinator

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and perfect for every day use.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for small group cooking - portions for 3 people. Great quality, sturdy and easy to clean. This has become my most used pan and am really considering getting the next size up too.
customer_reviews.author: Aarwen

customer_reviews.title: All-Clad is the Absolute Finest
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product after watching YouTube video of America's Test Kitchen recommendation. This pan is pricey, but will last a lifetime and get plenty of use.
customer_reviews.author: Topper Movius

customer_reviews.title: Well made pan
customer_reviews.text: You can’t use this for eggs . It’s not a one for all pan. This pan is very well made but it’s a bear to clean. I kept it. It’s a healthy choice. I am learning.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Wood Harris

customer_reviews.title: Quality pan, but expensive
customer_reviews.text: Maybe this kind of quality has to cost this much. Follow the directions for heating up the pan and it should last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: All-Clad Pans a great investment.
customer_reviews.text: All-Clad pans are always a great investment. They come at a price but wear well if you take care of them. We do tend to get some color on the "back" side of the pan but it does clean off with some effort.
customer_reviews.author: Father Knows Best

customer_reviews.title: Still the Pans All Others Are Judged
customer_reviews.text: NOTHING is better than ALL-CLAD except cooking on iron. I recommend using the Stainless Steel Chainmail Scrubber for iron cookware to clean the heavy cleaning jobs.
customer_reviews.author: THE KAISER

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable handle
customer_reviews.text: The handle is very uncomfortable, at least on the 8 inch fry pan.. compared to the calphalon pans i have the handle is extremely uncomfortable to hold, it has an edge that digs into the palm of your hand. The pan has even heat distribution and is easy to clean and should last a long time, but for the price in my opinion it should be comfortable to hold in your hand.
customer_reviews.author: dan gauthier

customer_reviews.title: This is the best pan I own
customer_reviews.text: I love all-clad and I love this pan. The stainless steel material is very durable. The handle is easy to grip and well balanced. Looks great and its easy to cook with and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Can take daily abuse with proper maintenance
customer_reviews.text: These pans have replaced much of our older non-stick. If used and cleaned properly we rarely have any sticking. We use them for everything from eggs to steaks to sauces to roasting whole chickens. Occasionally we’ll get some baked on splatter but it eventually comes clean. Comfy handles. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: a pen name

customer_reviews.title: Trusty professional workhorse.
customer_reviews.text: Great pan. It's a true professional workhorse. Not a pan for those that don't know how to cook with and care for stainless. The handle could have been made better. I feel like it's not as solid feeling as my Emril pans (also made by All-Clad).
customer_reviews.author: Marcel from Miami

customer_reviews.title: cools the food evenly.
customer_reviews.text: like the feel, cooking process, getting the knack of prepping to decrease cleaning effort after cooking, working on non stick !
customer_reviews.author: boris

customer_reviews.title: Great pan!
customer_reviews.text: I love it despite it’s a pain to clean. It just cooks everything so much better than non stick pans. It’s great to transfer from stove to oven and works as it is advertised. I’m going to buy smaller size one as well.
customer_reviews.author: KST

customer_reviews.title: My favorite pan
customer_reviews.text: This gorgeous pan is my go-to most of the time. It holds heat wonderfully well and cleans easily (with a little help from Bar Keeper's Friend when necessary). I love that it works so well with low heat. Eggs, pancakes, stir fry, sautés-- I've been delighted almost every time. (I say "almost" because there was that one incident with the potato latkes... but that's another story and now I use a cast-iron skillet for those.)
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Marshall

customer_reviews.title: All-Clad the last pan you need.
customer_reviews.text: There is no better plan than All-Clad. They clean well. They cook well, with even heat. I wouldn't by any other pan.
customer_reviews.author: Giverny

customer_reviews.title: EASILY CLEANED
customer_reviews.text: I love All-Clad pans (after switching from Caphalon). One worry I had before purchasing was clean up. I want folks to know that if you heat these pans first and apply a small amount of oil after the pan is hot, they clean up like a dream, wiping clean with a soft sponge, rivaling any no stick pan. If you do serious browning in them, you might need a little soak and scrubbing, but they clean up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Garden

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for industrial kitchenware and still manageable.
customer_reviews.text: This pan is a showstopper and i do not know how i ever got along without it all of this time. Cooks even on glasstop or gas.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Professional Pan for Professional Results
customer_reviews.text: Oh, I love this pan. Not only does it produce incredible browning and fond, but I know it will go in the oven at any temp with ruining it. Another product recommended by America's Test Kitchen I wish I had bought year's ago!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Apex cookware without a doubt
customer_reviews.text: This was my first All-Clad purchase and it won't be my last. You definitely want to get a container of Bar Keep's Friend as other have noted but I don't feel the need to use it every time I clean it. This pan retains heat very well and feels solid in the hand. This product will most certainly outlast me! The only negative about All-Clad is that I'm now hooked and need about another grand of cookware.
customer_reviews.author: Ricomalo

customer_reviews.title: Best Stainless Steel Pan
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many cheap stainless steel pans and this really is different
customer_reviews.author: Hassan Afzali-kusha

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift and I'm so happy for it!
customer_reviews.author: yezenia

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: What can you say about a frying pan that arrives in a blue-velvet carrying sack? I have had this more more than a year -- very easy to keep clean, heats evenly. Any better than a cheap frying plan? Yes, amazingly it is, and I am not a foodie or a gourmet cook. But I notice a big difference when using this pan -- no hot spots. One thing that I found odd -- if you use spray-on oils, it voids the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great pan, heats up very fast
customer_reviews.text: Great pan, heats up very fast. Holds heat well. MUST HAVE bar keepers friend to keep it clean. Remember this will stick, unlike a non stick pan. Preheat, THEN add oil. Works great for pan sauces. Would not cook super sticky things though like eggs. Great for meats.
customer_reviews.author: M. Malik

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic skillet
customer_reviews.text: Must have skillet! Well built and works great. Even heat distribution.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Hutson

customer_reviews.title: The best parn you can get
customer_reviews.text: Great pan with a heavy bottom end excellent finish. Can be a little difficult to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Is

customer_reviews.title: 12" stainless steel fry pan
customer_reviews.text: this 12" fry pan is nothing short of amazing it is thick tough beautiful and it works like the pro that it is. AWESOME
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing beats All-Clad I use this pan almost daily. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: LGR

customer_reviews.title: Look fantastic to boot
customer_reviews.text: Non-stick shouldn't go in the dishwasher. Cast iron doesn't do well with water. These have neither of those problems, and they. Look fantastic to boot. Great purchase if you can afford.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Fake
customer_reviews.text: This "All-Clad" has got to be a fake. I have others that distribute the heat evenly and wash cleanly. This is a POS and burns food on one side and doesn't let go of the food unless you scrub the #$%# out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: ... that I can make some wicked sauces from the perfect deglazing this pan allows
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated on buying this because of the price but I would have to say that I can make some wicked sauces from the perfect deglazing this pan allows. Solid construction that will last me for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Dietrich

customer_reviews.title: Really pleased with this pan
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased with this pan. Surface heats quickly and evenly. Very nice quality. Is very easy to clean but I highly recommend purchasing the all-clad stainless steel cleaner. You don't need to use the cleaner every time but it does help with the hard to get off food and returns the pan to its original luster. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Lukas D. Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Saute, fry, frittatas!
customer_reviews.text: Giant pan and is lovely for cooking large amounts. Don't try to hold it with one hand however. Too big which makes it a bit heavy for one hand. Handle on opposite side is very helpful but needs potholder.
customer_reviews.author: Crow Hill Gal

customer_reviews.title: Handle poorly executed
customer_reviews.text: The handle on this product was poorly executed. The edges of the handle at the end are poorly finished, not beveled enough and somewhat sharp, making it uncomfortable to grab and hold. There are better choices out there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best choice for a giant skillet that works on any stovetop
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift. She LOVED it. It has been on her wish list for decades, and now she's in heaven to have such a large skillet that works on her induction cooktop.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Burdine

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Even though packaging was not exactly as if shipped straight from Mars, golly gee what a product! Solid, well made. No doubt it should last decades.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel

customer_reviews.title: This is just wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Knowing the simple rules for using stainless steel pots, you can work wonders! Even unexpectedly, just great.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love this pan.
customer_reviews.text: Used it last night to make pork chops and gravy. Then used it this morning to cook eggs over easy. First time I've ever been able to cook eggs in stainless steel without them sticking. Cleaned up beautifully with little effort. Love this pan.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Pickelsimer

customer_reviews.title: Beauty!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this pan all the time, and the size is perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.author: Lou Collazo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pan!
customer_reviews.text: This pan is large and great for occasions when I'm cooking for a large crowd. There are no hot-spots and heat distribution is excellent. It's also easy to clean. The only reason that I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that the handle is too narrow, in my opinion, for this size pan. Not really the pan's fault it's just that I have large hands but a least the gripping feature in the front of the pan helps a great deal. One final note, even though the pan is dishwasher safe, if you want to maintain that bright, just-like-new finish, wash it buy hand.
customer_reviews.author: Alessandro J. Veralli

customer_reviews.title: Worth Buying
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent pan. It is very heavy weight and quite large. I have used it many times to pan roast veggies. It holds the heat quite well, has room for a good amount of food and cleans easily.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ravetta

customer_reviews.title: Great Skillet forCooking Meat and other Meals
customer_reviews.text: This skillet works great at low temperatures. It gives a great sear and cooks evenly. The food barely sticks to the skillet as long as you use a little oil and it cleans up nice and shiny. I use it to cook meats and also to make pre-prepared meals that come frozen.
customer_reviews.author: David Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The product I've received has "Oven- and broiler-safe up to 500 degrees F", not 600.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R.

customer_reviews.title: Georgeous, excellent quality. Happy to see people alsi giving great reviews. This would be the very last pan set one would ever
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best investment I have made. Arrived on time and looks beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Juanita J.

customer_reviews.title: Great Pan.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Quality construction, good handle, heats very evenly, cleans up easily. There is a larning curve with uncoated pans - proper lubrication before cooking, temp control, and cleaning / maintenance are all different than with non-stick pans - just like cooking with cast iron is different. But, the difference is worth it. Non-stick is easy, but you can't put it in the oven and the quickly will chip / scratch so even the best coated non-stick eventually has to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: BJSailor

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: I expected more from this pan! I have cheaper pans that out perform and are easier to clean. The build up of oil on this pan is awful, you have to be careful with it and it is not versatile. I would not purchase this again!
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: It is a great pan! Love all the All-Clad pans
customer_reviews.text: I got the 14" pan. It is a great pan! Love all the All-Clad pans.
customer_reviews.author: Adam N

customer_reviews.title: Works well; holds up decently over time
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for several months now and use it pretty often. It heats evenly, develops a nice fond, cleans up nicely, and has generally just done what a skillet should do. The slopped sides give good room to get cooking tools into the pan, and the metal handle makes it easy to finish in the oven.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: great frying pan
customer_reviews.text: this pan was reco'd by Cooks magazine and i truly believe it is one one best frying pans on the market.my wife uses it all the time
customer_reviews.author: jersey pop

customer_reviews.title: Best stainless pans to be had
customer_reviews.text: Best pan there is for durability and heat transfer. If you are in expert like me, keep a couple green scrub pads on hand to clean up burned residue.
customer_reviews.author: Kuma

customer_reviews.title: Great pan
customer_reviews.text: Overall very good quality. U had a few issues with discoloration on the bottom after a few months of use, but otherwise it has worked incredibly
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Wood

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love this frying pan. Light-weight but quality materials. I cook three meals a day from scratch so this gets a ton of use.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Windstar

customer_reviews.title: I love my All-Clad!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! It's just the right size, it's easy to clean..just what I wanted...same quality as the rest of my set
customer_reviews.author: Kristine Leoffler

customer_reviews.title: I am fond of this pan
customer_reviews.text: This pan heats evenly and Browns perfectly. Americas test kitchen was right again.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: Permanent Addition
customer_reviews.text: Great pan. Should last forever. Use Bar Keeper's Friend to clean when anything sticks to it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H

customer_reviews.title: It is enough deep and in good size.
customer_reviews.text: It is very good pan. It comes to me very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Great Skillet
customer_reviews.text: I had a 10" Calphalon skillet that everything stuck to, no matter what I did. So, I replaced it with this 10" All Clad and solved the problem. I don't like to use non-stick pans, because of the temperature restrictions. I am very happy with my All Clad skillet.
customer_reviews.author: JLC

customer_reviews.title: Great pan worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Love this pan! Evenly heats foods and is wonderful for cooking. Was received promptly.
customer_reviews.author: MDC65

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This pan is great, once you learn the heat your in good cooking world
customer_reviews.author: doowop

customer_reviews.title: perfect cooks and chefs pan for most uses in our ...
customer_reviews.text: Fonds out the window with this pan ,perfect cooks and chefs pan for most uses in our kitchen!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Holm

customer_reviews.title: Excellent distribution of heat
customer_reviews.text: We use it to heat up the food. Excellent distribution of heat!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Frying Pan
customer_reviews.text: I love to cook and this Frying Pan does the job.
customer_reviews.author: stephen watts

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like? Wish I had started collecting sooner
customer_reviews.text: All-Clad......What's not to like? Wish I had started collecting sooner...
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Tough to clean
customer_reviews.text: I love the way it destributes heat so evenly but I wish I had gotten the non-stick. Cleaning it has been a challenge so I find myself not using it as much as I would like.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne H. Black

customer_reviews.title: Great cookware. This is our second All-Clad
customer_reviews.text: Great cookware. This is our second All-Clad, and this one is used for eggs only. Very high quality, great cooking, easy cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Jeryl Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: i love this pan. it sears meat great and is so well constructed
customer_reviews.author: J D K

customer_reviews.title: I Love All Clad
customer_reviews.text: Other pans don't compare to the quality of an All Clad. For somebody who has not used stainless steel pans it may take some practice to use. Try different heat settings, always use a lubricant, and use bar keepers friend to maintain a clean surface. All Clad pans are well worth the price knowing it will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: TJD

customer_reviews.title: Great Pan
customer_reviews.text: This pan is very well made and a pleasure to use.
customer_reviews.author: Suleman Sobani

customer_reviews.title: Great pan!
customer_reviews.text: More than met expectations. Comes sparkling clean using "bar keepers friend" after soaking and washing with dish detergent.
customer_reviews.author: Teri M

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: Love this pan. Perfect for searing steaks or getting a nice crispy skin on fish.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy & great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pan! Love the stainless steel and the handle stays cool. Also, it is made in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: TranMD

customer_reviews.title: Nice size! 14 inches.
customer_reviews.text: This sucker is huge! One batch cooking so oil is fresher through the cook. I don't miss not having a top.
customer_reviews.author: Lexus4811

customer_reviews.title: The best pan
customer_reviews.text: This is the best pan that I've ever owned. Even heating, quality stainless. I like it so much that I've ordered 2 more. Yes, pricey however I'm betting it will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Vic M

product_meta.title: All-Clad 4110 Stainless Steel Tri-Ply Bonded Dishwasher Safe Fry Pan / Cookware, 10-Inch, Silver
product_meta.description: Size:10-InchA true kitchen staple, the All-Clad Stainless 4110 10-Inch fry pan is ideal for searing, browning, and pan-frying everything from eggs to meats. The fry pan features a flat bottom and flared sides that make tossing foods effortless and allow for easy turning with a spatula. The All-Clad frying pan is great for cooking at higher heat with oils to develop foods with full rich flavor, color, and crisp texture. All-Clad’s Stainless 3-ply cookware features a thick-gauge aluminum core that attracts heat fast, while the addition of stainless steel ensures even heat distribution for consistent results across the entire cooking surface, all the way to the rim. Even more, its stainless-steel interior with a starburst finish offers natural stick resistance, letting you know when food is ready to release, and it won’t react with ingredients, so there’s no risk of food picking up a metallic taste. Made in the USA, this stainless-steel cookware offers warp-resistant strength and dishwasher-safe convenience, plus it can be used on any cooktop, including induction. Discover what it means to cook with All-Clad’s most popular cookware collection–All-Clad Stainless is a classic choice for anyone who loves to cook.
feature_bullets: 10-Inch fry pan with wide flat base and versatile low-profile shape
3-ply bonded construction consists of durable stainless steel encapsulating an aluminum core for even heating throughout
Highly polished cooking surface with starburst finish offers stick resistance and easy maintenance, plus won’t react with food
Contoured stainless-steel handles permanently secured with stainless-steel rivets; capacity etched on base. Heat source - Induction - Gas - Electric - Ceramic - Halogen
Oven- and broiler-safe up to 600 degrees F; induction compatible; limited lifetime warranty; Made in USA.Material:Alu triply
